name: White meadowfoam
overview: Annual flower that is endemic to California. Its can be seen from May to June, but can bloom as early as March following rain showers. It's oily nutritious seed may be highly sough after by many insects, animals, and rodents. Blooms from April to June.
habitat: Germinates in areas after rain falls, it's oily seeds spread by floating on top of water. It grows in wet grasslands, seeps, and vernal pools. It grows in foothills and grasslands but prefers wet areas where they can soak up a lot of sun.
